questions.question: Let T:R<sup>n</sup>→R<sup>n</sup> be the one-to-one onto linear transformation and let T(X)=b, b∈R<sup>n</sup>, be a linear map equation. Then it has
Let T:R<sup>3</sup>→R<sup>2</sup> be the linear transformation defined by T(x, y, z)=(x, y+z), where x, y, z∈R. Consider the linear map equation T(X)=b, where b=(1, 0). Then

answers.a: Solution exists and there are infinitely many solutions
answers.b: Solution exists and there are finite but more than one solutions

questions.question: Let T:R<sup>2</sup>→R<sup>3</sup> be the linear transformation defined by T(x, y)=(x, x+y, x-y), where x, y∈R. Consider the linear map equation T(X)=b, where b=(1, 0, 0). Then

answers.a: Solution exists and there are infinitely many solutions
answers.b: Solution exists and there are finite but more than one number of solution

questions.question: Let T:R<sup>2</sup>→R<sup>2</sup> be the linear transformation defined by T(x, y)=(3x, 4x), where x, y∈R and let b=(3, 4). Then which of following is a solution of the linear map equation T(X)=b

Let T:R<sup>2</sup>→R<sup>2</sup> be the linear transformation defined by T(x, y)=(y, 0), where x, y∈R. Let the statements A and B be as given below: 
 A: The linear map equation T(X)=(1, 4) is consistent. 
 B: The linear map equation T(X)=(4, 0) is consistent.
Then which of following holds

answers.a: A is true, B is false
answers.b: A is false, B is true
answers.c: A is true, B is true
answers.d: A is false, B is false
